meanings.definition: The process of drying out completely.
meanings.sent1: The desiccation of the fruit left it shriveled and hard.
meanings.sent2: After days in the sun, the desiccation of the mud made it crack and crumble.
meanings.sent3: The desiccation of the sponge turned it into a tiny, dry brick.
meanings.sent4: The desiccation of the lake revealed a vast expanse of cracked earth.
meanings.sent5: The desiccation of the flower petals made them papery and fragile.

meanings.definition: The state of being dried out.
meanings.sent1: The desiccation of the wood caused it to splinter easily.
meanings.sent2: The desert showed signs of desiccation with its barren, cracked ground.
meanings.sent3: The desiccation of the cookie made it impossible to dunk in milk.
meanings.sent4: The desiccation of the old leather jacket gave it a weathered appearance.
meanings.sent5: The desiccation of the skin from the sunburn was painful and itchy.
